Operation 'WarmUpIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description is too brief and lacks critical details. data.current_summary: Start warming up an IP address
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to put an IP address into warmup mode.**
data.description_suggestion: Initiates automated IP warmup for a dedicated IP address. Accepts the IP address as input and enables SendGrid's gradual email volume increase according to the predetermined warmup schedule. Returns the warmup configuration details including the IP address and current warmup status. Once activated, the IP address will have hourly send limits that gradually increase based on warmup duration.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks critical details. Missing: what input is required (IP address), what the operation returns (warmup configuration), and important side effects (hourly send limits will be applied). Enhanced description provides complete context for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose, inputs, outputs, and effects on email sending behavior.

data.current_summary: Retrieve all IPs currently in warmup
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your IP addresses that are currently warming up.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all dedicated IP addresses currently in warmup mode. Returns an array of IP addresses with their current warmup status, including warmup progress and applicable hourly send limits. Use this endpoint to monitor which IPs are actively warming up and their current stage in the warmup schedule.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks details about what is returned. Enhanced description specifies the response format (array), what information is included (warmup status, progress, send limits), and provides context for when an AI agent should use this operation (monitoring warmup progress).

message: Operation 'GetWarmUpIp' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Current description is minimal and doesn't explain what data is returned. data.current_summary: Retrieve the warmup status for a specific IP address
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the warmup status for a specific IP address.**

You can retrieve all of your warming IPs using the "Retrieve all IPs currently in warmup" endpoint.
- Tags: IP Warmup
- Response Schemas: 200
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed warmup status information for a specific IP address. Requires the IP address as a path parameter. Returns the IP's current warmup stage, progress percentage, applicable hourly send limit, and estimated time to complete warmup. Use this endpoint to check an individual IP's warmup progress before making sending decisions or before removing it from warmup mode.
data.reasoning: Current description is minimal and doesn't explain what data is returned. Enhanced description specifies the required input (IP address parameter), detailed output fields (stage, progress, limits, timeline), and provides context for when to use this operation. Also clarifies the relationship to the StopIpWarmUp operation.

message: Operation 'StopIpWarmUp' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description has a typo ('warmpup') and lacks clarity about side effects. Enhanced description clarifies the success response (204), explains the important side effect (removal of hourly send limits enabling full-volume sending), and provides actionable guidance about checking status before removal. Better formatted for AI agent interpretation.

data.current_summary: Stop warming up an IP address
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to remove an IP address from warmup mode.**

Your request will return a 204 status code if the specified IP was successfully removed from warmup mode. To retrieve details of the IP's warmup status *before* removing it from warmup mode, call the  "Retrieve the warmpup status for a specific IP address" endpoint.
- Tags: IP Warmup
data.description_suggestion: Removes a dedicated IP address from warmup mode. Requires the IP address as a path parameter. Returns a 204 No Content status on successful removal. Once removed from warmup, the IP address will no longer have hourly send limits and can be used for full-volume sending. Recommend retrieving the IP's warmup status before removal to confirm completion of warmup if desired.
data.reasoning: Current description has a typo ('warmpup') and lacks clarity about side effects. Enhanced description clarifies the success response (204), explains the important side effect (removal of hourly send limits enabling full-volume sending), and provides actionable guidance about checking status before removal. Better formatted for AI agent interpretation.
